intro: Matelea fucata, commonly known as the yellow mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy yellow flowers with five petals, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and the stems are often hairy. Matelea fucata thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or arid environments.
